TypeSignature.Value: public class CCNode : CocosSharp.ICCFocusable, CocosSharp.ICCKeypadDelegate, CocosSharp.ICCUpdatable, IComparable<CocosSharp.CCNode>, System.Collections.Generic.IComparer<CocosSharp.CCNode>

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCNode extends System.Object implements class CocosSharp.ICCFocusable, class CocosSharp.ICCKeypadDelegate, class CocosSharp.ICCUpdatable, class System.Collections.Generic.IComparer`1<class CocosSharp.CCNode>, class System.IComparable`1<class CocosSharp.CCNode>

summary.para: The base class for all elements displayed.

remarks.para: Anything that gets drawn or contains things that get drawn is a CCNode. The most common CCNodes are: , , and .

The main features of a are:
They can contain other Node nodes (AddChild, GetChildByTag, RemoveChild)
They can schedule periodic callbacks (Schedule, Unschedule, etc)
They can execute actions (RunAction, StopAction)
Subclassing a CCNode involves initializing resources and scheduling any desired callbacks as well as overriding the draw method to render the node.

remarks.para: Sets the additional transform.

para.para: The additional transform will be concatenated at the end of NodeToParentTransform. It could be used to simulate parent-child relationship between two nodes (e.g. one is in BatchNode, another isn't). //createabatchNodeSpriteBatchNode*batch=SpriteBatchNode::create("Icon-114.png");this->addChild(batch);//createtwosprites,spriteAwillbeaddedtobatchNode,theyareusingdifferenttextures.Sprite*spriteA=Sprite::createWithTexture(batch->getTexture());Sprite*spriteB=Sprite::create("Icon-72.png");batch->addChild(spriteA);//Wecan'tmakespriteBasspriteA'schildsincetheyusedifferenttextures.Sojustaddittolayer.//Butwewanttosimulate`parent-child`relationshipforthesetwonode.this->addChild(spriteB);//positionspriteA->setPosition(Point(200,200));//GetsthespriteA'stransform.AffineTransformt=spriteA->nodeToParentTransform();//SetstheadditionaltransformtospriteB,spriteB'spostionwillbasedonitspseudoparenti.e.spriteA.spriteB->setAdditionalTransform(t);//scalespriteA->setScale(2);//GetsthespriteA'stransform.t=spriteA->nodeToParentTransform();//SetstheadditionaltransformtospriteB,spriteB'sscalewillbasedonitspseudoparenti.e.spriteA.spriteB->setAdditionalTransform(t);//rotationspriteA->setRotation(20);//GetsthespriteA'stransform.t=spriteA->nodeToParentTransform();//SetstheadditionaltransformtospriteB,spriteB'srotationwillbasedonitspseudoparenti.e.spriteA.spriteB->setAdditionalTransform(t);

remarks.para: The additional transform will be concatenated at the end of nodeToParentTransform. It could be used to simulate parent-child relationship between two nodes (e.g. one is in BatchNode, another isn't). //createabatchNodeSpriteBatchNode*batch=SpriteBatchNode::create("Icon-114.png");this->addChild(batch);//createtwosprites,spriteAwillbeaddedtobatchNode,theyareusingdifferenttextures.Sprite*spriteA=Sprite::createWithTexture(batch->getTexture());Sprite*spriteB=Sprite::create("Icon-72.png");batch->addChild(spriteA);//Wecan'tmakespriteBasspriteA'schildsincetheyusedifferenttextures.Sojustaddittolayer.//Butwewanttosimulate`parent-child`relationshipforthesetwonode.this->addChild(spriteB);//positionspriteA->setPosition(Point(200,200));//GetsthespriteA'stransform.AffineTransformt=spriteA->nodeToParentTransform();//SetstheadditionaltransformtospriteB,spriteB'spostionwillbasedonitspseudoparenti.e.spriteA.spriteB->setAdditionalTransform(t);//scalespriteA->setScale(2);//GetsthespriteA'stransform.t=spriteA->nodeToParentTransform();//SetstheadditionaltransformtospriteB,spriteB'sscalewillbasedonitspseudoparenti.e.spriteA.spriteB->setAdditionalTransform(t);//rotationspriteA->setRotation(20);//GetsthespriteA'stransform.t=spriteA->nodeToParentTransform();//SetstheadditionaltransformtospriteB,spriteB'srotationwillbasedonitspseudoparenti.e.spriteA.spriteB->setAdditionalTransform(t);

MemberSignature.Value: public CocosSharp.CCRawList<CocosSharp.CCNode> Children { get; protected set; }

remarks.para: Return an array of children

Composing a "tree" structure is a very important feature of Here's a sample code of traversing children array: Node*node=NULL;CCARRAY_FOREACH(parent->getChildren(),node){node->setPosition(0,0);} This sample code traverses all children nodes, and set theie position to (0,0)

item.description: glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 NumberOfRunningActions() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the numbers of actions that are running plus the ones that are schedule to run (actions in actionsToAdd and actions arrays).

remarks.para: Returns the numbers of actions that are running plus the ones that are schedule to run (actions in actionsToAdd and actions arrays).
Composable actions are counted as 1 action. Example: If you are running 1 of 7 actions, it will return 1. If you are running 7 Sequences of 2 actions, it will return 7.

para.para: The number of actions that are running plus the ones that are schedule to run

remarks.para: The number of actions that are running plus the ones that are schedule to run

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnEnter() cil managed

Docs.summary: Event callback that is invoked every time when enters the 'stage'. If the enters the 'stage' with a transition, this event is called when the transition starts. During onEnter you can't access a "sister/brother" node. If you override onEnter, you shall call its parent's one, e.g., Node::onEnter().

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnEnterTransitionDidFinish() cil managed

Docs.summary: Event callback that is invoked when the enters in the 'stage'. If the enters the 'stage' with a transition, this event is called when the transition finishes. If you override onEnterTransitionDidFinish, you shall call its parent's one, e.g. Node::onEnterTransitionDidFinish()

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnExit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Event callback that is invoked every time the leaves the 'stage'. If the leaves the 'stage' with a transition, this event is called when the transition finishes. During onExit you can't access a sibling node. If you override onExit, you shall call its parent's one, e.g., Node::onExit().

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnExitTransitionDidStart() cil managed

Docs.summary: Event callback that is called every time the leaves the 'stage'. If the leaves the 'stage' with a transition, this callback is called when the transition starts.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void ScheduleUpdate() cil managed

remarks.para: Schedules the "update" method.

It will use the order number 0. This method will be called every frame. Scheduled methods with a lower order value will be called before the ones that have a higher order value. Only one "update" method could be scheduled per node.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void ScheduleUpdateWithPriority(int32 priority) cil managed

Docs.summary: Schedules the "update" method with a custom priority.

remarks.para: Schedules the "update" method with a custom priority.

This selector will be called every frame. Scheduled methods with a lower priority will be called before the ones that have a higher value. Only one "update" selector could be scheduled per node (You can't have 2 'update' selectors).

Docs.summary: Sets position in a more efficient way.

remarks.para: Sets position in a more efficient way.
Passing two numbers (x,y) is much efficient than passing Point object. This method is binded to lua and javascript. Passing a number is 10 times faster than passing a object from lua to c++

remarks.para: Calls children's updateTransform() method recursively.

This method is moved from , so it's no longer specific to . As the result, you apply 's optimization on your customed . e.g., batchNode->addChild(myCustomNode), while you can only addChild(sprite) before.

Docs.summary: Sets a custom user data pointer

remarks.para: Sets a custom user data pointer

You can set everything in UserData pointer, a data block, a structure or an object, etc.
Don't forget to release the memroy manually, especially before you change this data pointer, and before this node is autoreleased.
Don't forget to release the memroy manually, especially before you change this data pointer, and before this node is autoreleased.
Returns a user assigned Object

Similar to UserData, but instead of holding a void* it holds an object. The UserObject will be retained once in this method, and the previous UserObject (if existed) will be relese. The UserObject will be released in 's destructure.
